sen.j: 高野瀬 宗則（たかのせ むねのり、1852年11月3日（嘉永5年9月22日 (旧暦)） - 1915年（大正4年））は、理学士。
sen.e: Munenori TAKANOSE (November 3, 1852 - 1915) was a bachelor of science.
Munenori TAKANOSE (November 3, 1852 - 1915) was a bachelor of science.
Munenori TAKANOSE (November 3, 1852 - 1915) was a bachelor of science.

sen.j: 東京物理学講習所（後の東京物理学校、現在の東京理科大学）の創立者の一人である。
sen.e: He was one of the founders of Tokyo Butsurigaku Koshujo (Tokyo Training Institute of Physics) (later, Tokyo Butsuri Gakko (Tokyo School of Physics), current Tokyo University of Science).
sen.cmt: 東京物理学校および東京物理学講習所の定訳不明
sen.e: He was one of the founders of Tokyo Butsurigaku Koshujo (Tokyo Training Institute of Physics) (later, Tokyo Butsuri Gakko (Tokyo School of Physics), current Tokyo University of Science).
He was one of the founders of Tokyo Butsurigaku Koshujo (Tokyo Training Institute of Physics) (later, Tokyo Butsuri Gakko (Tokyo School of Physics), current Tokyo University of Science).

sen.j: 1852年（嘉永5年） - 近江国彦根市に生まれる。
sen.e: 1852: He was born in Hikone City, Omi Province.
1852: He was born in Hikone City, Omi Province.
1852: He was born in Hikone City, Omi Province.

sen.j: 1871年（明治4年） - 貢進生となり、開成学校（後の開成学校、東京大学）に入学する。
sen.e: 1871: He became a Koshinsei (student who was recommended by each domain) and entered Kaisei Gakko (later Kaisei School, the University of Tokyo).
1871: He became a Koshinsei (student who was recommended by each domain) and entered Kaisei Gakko (later Kaisei School, the University of Tokyo).
1871: He became a Koshinsei (student who was recommended by each domain) and entered Kaisei Gakko (later Kaisei School, the University of Tokyo).

sen.j: 貢進生制度廃止後、私費で開成学校に入学。
sen.e: After the abolition of Koshinsei system, he entered Kaisei Gakko at his private expense.
After the abolition of Koshinsei system, he entered Kaisei Gakko at his private expense.
After the abolition of Koshinsei system, he entered Kaisei Gakko at his private expense.

sen.j: 1879年（明治12年）7月 - 東京大学仏語物理学科第2期卒業。
sen.e: July, 1879: He was a second-batch graduate of the Faculty of Buddhistic terms and Physics of the University of Tokyo.
July, 1879: He was a second-batch graduate of the Faculty of Buddhistic terms and Physics of the University of Tokyo.
July, 1879: He was a second-batch graduate of the Faculty of Buddhistic terms and Physics of the University of Tokyo.

sen.j: 卒業後は、駒場農学校で教鞭をとる。
sen.e: After the graduation, he taught at Komaba Nogakko (Komaba Agricultural School).
After the graduation, he taught at Komaba Nogakko (Komaba Agricultural School).
After the graduation, he taught at Komaba Nogakko (Komaba Agricultural School).

sen.j: 1881年（明治14年） - 東京物理学講習所の創立者の一人となる。
sen.e: 1881: He became one of the founders of Tokyo Butsurigaku Koshujo.
1881: He became one of the founders of Tokyo Butsurigaku Koshujo.
1881: He became one of the founders of Tokyo Butsurigaku Koshujo.

sen.j: 1883年（明治16年） - 東京物理学講習所所長を辞する。
sen.e: 1883: He resigned as the chief of Tokyo Butsurigaku Koshujo.
1883: He resigned as the chief of Tokyo Butsurigaku Koshujo.
1883: He resigned as the chief of Tokyo Butsurigaku Koshujo.

sen.j: 1885年（明治18年） - 東京物理学校維持同盟員となる。
sen.e: 1885: He became a member of the union of preservation of Tokyo Butsuri Gakko.
sen.cmt: 東京物理学校維持同盟の定訳不明
sen.e: 1885: He became a member of the union of preservation of Tokyo Butsuri Gakko.
1885: He became a member of the union of preservation of Tokyo Butsuri Gakko.

sen.j: 1886年（明治19年） - 農商務省工務局権度課長となる。
sen.e: 1886: He became the chief of Weights and Measures Section of Public Works Bureau of Ministry of Agriculture and Commerce.
1886: He became the chief of Weights and Measures Section of Public Works Bureau of Ministry of Agriculture and Commerce.
1886: He became the chief of Weights and Measures Section of Public Works Bureau of Ministry of Agriculture and Commerce.

sen.j: 1891年（明治24年） - 度量衡法を制定する。
sen.e: 1891: He established The Weights and Measures Act.
1891: He established The Weights and Measures Act.
1891: He established The Weights and Measures Act.

sen.j: 1894年（明治27年）3月 - 大日本度量衡協会（後に、日本度量衡協会、日本計量協会、現在の日本計量振興協会）設立に伴い、副会長となる。
sen.e: March, 1894: With the establishment of Dainihon Doryoko Kyokai (Metrological Association of the Great Empire of Japan (later Japan Metrological Association, Japan Measuring Association, current Japan Association for Metrology Promotion), he became a vice-president.
sen.cmt: 大日本度量衡協会、日本度量衡協会、日本計量協会の定訳不明
sen.e: March, 1894: With the establishment of Dainihon Doryoko Kyokai (Metrological Association of the Great Empire of Japan (later Japan Metrological Association, Japan Measuring Association, current Japan Association for Metrology Promotion), he became a vice-president.

March, 1894: With the establishment of Dainihon Doryoko Kyokai (Metrological Association of the Great Empire of Japan (later Japan Metrological Association, Japan Measuring Association, current Japan Association for Metrology Promotion), he became a vice-president.

sen.j: 1907年（明治40年） - 退官し、大日本度量衡株式会社を設立。
sen.e: 1907: He retired from the post and established Dainihon Doryoko Kabushikigaisya (Metrological company of the Great Empire of Japan).
sen.cmt: 大日本度量衡株式会社の定訳不明
sen.e: 1907: He retired from the post and established Dainihon Doryoko Kabushikigaisya (Metrological company of the Great Empire of Japan).
